lead_paragraph: In two lawsuits seeking class-action status, workers say they were fired or demoted for acting ethically and falling short of unrealistic sales goals.

headline.print_headline: Wells Fargo Workers Claim Retaliation for Playing by the Rules
headline.main: Wells Fargo Workers Claim Retaliation for Playing by the Rules

snippet: In two lawsuits seeking class-action status, workers say they were fired or demoted for acting ethically and falling short of unrealistic sales goals....
abstract: Wells Fargo employees who claim they were penalized for being ethical are starting to coalesce around two lawsuits filed in California that are seeking class-action status; attorney Jonathan Delshad says bank booted employees who did not engage in illegal practice of opening accounts without consent of customers; expects class of current and former employees could grow to tens of thousands of people nationwide.
